intro: Rosa wagneriana var. hinkei, commonly known as the Hinkéi rose, is a variant of the Wagner's rose native to Japan. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces fragrant, pink to red flowers in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features include small, oval-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens due to its aesthetic appeal and hardiness.
